results.title: The Navigators: Baudin vs Flinders
results.creator_credit: Klaus Toft, ABC-TV (Australia) and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: This two-part documentary series celebrates the 200th anniversary of the great voyages of discovery by Matthew Flinders (1774-1814) and Nicolas Baudin (1750-1803), leaders of two separate expeditions, one English, the other French, which were sent out by their governments in 1801 to chart the unknown southern coast of Australia and collect botanical specimens. Britain was intent on remaining the leading maritime power. She also needed somewhere to dump her undesirables and convicts having lost her penal colonies in North America after the War of Independence, while France, stripped of her Canadian colonies by England, was seeking a ‘New France’ in the south. Both nations were also desirous of enhancing their Museum collections with specimens from all the Natural History sciences. Their expeditions ranged the Pacific Ocean and, gradually, their maps defined the elusive southern continent, Terra Australis Incognita. The series focuses on the great hardships faced by the ambitious rival captains and their impressive achievements which have largely been overlooked by history. Narrated by Adrian Mulraney. A companion website is available at: http://www.abc.net.au/navigators

results.title: The Navajo: shepherds of the desert
results.creator_credit: J. Donald McIntyre, Southventure Films and Coleman Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Describes a day in the life of a typical Navajo family. Shows the family at work, the tending and shearing sheep, rug weaving and the family’s social life.

results.title: The Naughty owlet
results.creator_credit: Hungarofilm, Gyula Macskassy and Gyorgy Varwai
results.brief_description: An animated story of a family of baby owls who live in a hollow tree. One little owl refuses to learn to fly and while his brothers work hard, he spends his time looking at television. One day he is caught outside the nest by a fox and needs desperately to fly to get away. The owl flounders and is almost caught, but with the help of his brothers gets away.

results.title: The Nature of science: how ideas change
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Dick Larson
results.brief_description: Scientific ideas are shown to be in a continual stage of modification and change. We investigate how and why scientific ideas change and in so doing clarify the criteria used to evaluate them, such as their accuracy, simplicity, productivity and scope. For primary grades.

group_works.title: Testing hypotheses
group_works.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Media

results.title: The Nature of salt
results.brief_description: A short documentary showing how salt affects different environments, for example, how it kills grass. Also shows some laboratory-like experiments such as “water taking salt from soil”. Towards the end of the film we also see aspects of ‘salt mining’ via live footage and diagrams.

results.title: The Nature of prejudice: ' I wear my people's clothes'
results.creator_credit: Linda Schuyler, Playing With Time, Canadian Council of Christians and Jews and Kit Hood
results.brief_description: Attempts to break down people’s prejudices to people of other cultures by putting forward the view that prejudice is the result of fear based on lack of understanding. Interviews several people of ethnic origins living in Canada who still follow the customs and beliefs of their own cultures, including the wearing of particular clothing and hairstyles. Narrated by Professor Jamshed Mavalwala. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Nature of Light
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Two teenage boys (Bud and Sandy) on a camping trip, demonstrate the uses of light through various practical experiments. Demonstrations include: the law of reflection, differences between convex and concave lenses, how the eye works etc.

results.title: The Nature of life: respiration in animals
results.brief_description: Explores the similarities of air-breathing and water-breathing animals, developing this concept through the animal kingdom to man himself. Demonstrations show the vital relationships between the animal’s size and the complexity of its respiratory system - between respiration, blood circulation and feeding.

results.title: The Nature of heat
results.brief_description: Explains heat as the energy of molecular motion. Experiments are used to demonstrate that heat is transferred by conduction, convection and radiation. Shows the effectiveness of various types of material in the transfer of heat.
